title: Team menu disappears from Hierarchy and Packages view
description: The team menu is no longer visible in the Hierarchy and Packages view after performing certain steps. It was previously visible in step 9. Note: TestClass.java is not in any CVS repository, but I first noticed the problem with a file managed by CVS.
OB: The team menu is not available when selecting the TestClass in the package view and opening the popup menu.
EB: The team menu is expected to be available when selecting the TestClass in the package view and opening the popup menu.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1) Open Eclipse with a new workspace.
2) Open the Java perspective and close the resource perspective.
3) Create a Java Project named 'TestProject'.
4) Create a Java class named 'TestClass'.
5) Paste the provided code in the TestClass and save it.
6) Change the preference 'WorkbenchPerspective' to open the perspective in a new window.
7) Change the preference 'Java' to 'Open a new Type Hierarchy Perspective'.
8) Exit the workbench and restart it.
9) Select the TestClass (the class, not the unit) in the package view and open the popup menu.
10) Exit the workbench and restart it.
11) Select the word 'InnerClass' in the text editor and press F4.
12) Open the popup menu on the new hierarchy view. The team menu should not be there, as it is an inner class.
13) Select the word 'TestClass' in the new text editor and press F4. The team menu should be there, as it is not an inner class.
14) There should be 3 opened windows. Close the two new windows.
15) Select the TestClass in the package view and open the popup menu. The team menu is no longer there.
